4.  Five-year Accident History
The facility has not experienced any reportable accidents in the past 5 years.

5.  Emergency Response Program
Tremco Corsicana has a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous material, which is in place to protect workers and public safety, and the environment.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas.  Employees receive training in emergency procedures.  To ensure proper functioning, emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced.  In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within processes that would require a modified emergency response.  The emergency plan has been coordinated with and verified by the Navarro County the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).

At all times there must be at least one employee either on the facility premises or on-call (i.e. available to respond to an emergency by reaching the facility within a short period of time) with the responsibility for coordination of all emergency response measures.  This emergency coordinator will be thoroughly familiar with all aspects of the facility's emergency response plan, all operations and activities at the facility, the location and characteristics of material/waste handled, the location of all records within the facility, and the facility layout.

Hot Work Permit
Tremco Corsicana will issue a hot work permit for hot work operations conducted on or near a covered process.   Permit shall document that the fire prevention and protection requirements have been implemented prior to beginning the hot work operations; it shall indicate the date(s) authorized for hot work; and identify the object on which hot work is to be performed.  The permit will be kept on file until completion of the hot work operations.

Contractors
Tremco Corsicana hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety performance of the contractor is carried out.  Before any contractors are allowed to work at Tremco Corsicana, they undergo an orientation conducted by the PSM team.  During this orientation contractors are made aware of the known potential hazards related to the contractor's work, the hazards of regulated substances within  Tremco Corsicana, the safe work procedures insisted on by Tremco Corsicana, and familiarized with the Hot Work Permit Policy and the Lock Out/Tag Out procedures used at Tremco Corsicana.  Contractors are informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of a regulated substance occur, and this information includes evacuation routes and assembly points.  Tremco Corsicana will document that the contractor has received and understands the training.

Process operators, maintenance personnel or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the modification.

Pre-startup Reviews
Pre-startup safety reviews related to new processes and to modification in established processes will be conducted as a regular practice at Tremco Corsicana.  These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction and equipment is in accordance with design specifications, and safety, operating, maintenance, and emergency procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

Compliance Audits
Tremco Corsicana conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented.  These audits are carried out by at least one person knowledgeable in the process and are conducted at least every 3 years.  Audit findings are documented in a report.  Any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are undertaken in a safe and prompt manner and are also documented.  The facility will maintain the two most recent compliance audit reports.

Incident Investigation
Tremco Corsicana promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of a regulated substance.  An incident investigation will be initiated as promptly as possible, but not later than 48 hours after the incident, and will involve at least one person knowledgeable of the process involved.  These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring.  A report will be prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and will include any resolutions and corrective action.  All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years.

Tremco Corsicana develops and implements safety work practices to provide for the control of hazards during operations such as lockout/tagout/confined space entry; opening process equipment or piping; and control over entrance into stationary source by maintenance, contractor, laboratory, or other support personnel.  These safe work practices apply to employees and contractor employees.

Training
Tremco  Corsicana has a training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating processes are competent in the operating procedures associated with these processes.  Initial training of operators is provided, and refresher training is provided as required.  Both initial and refresher training is documented and records of training are maintained onsite for at least 3 years.

Mechanical Integrity
Tremco Corsicana has written procedures for maintaining on-going integrity of process equipment, which incorporates training for process maintenance activities, inspection and testing, corrective action for equipment deficiencies and the application of quality assurance measures.  Tremco Corsicana carries out documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper installation and operations.  Process equipment examined by these checks includes among others: pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, control and pumps.  Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified and trained personnel.  Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.  The plant also incorporates quality assurance measures to ensure that equipment and parts are suitable for the process application for which they will be used.

Process Safety Information
Tremco Corsicana maintains a detailed record of process safety information that describes the hazards of regulated substances, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all processes.  Much of the information was compiled during the preparation of the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA).  Chemical-specific information, including exposure hazards and emergency response/exposure treatment considerations, is provided in material safety data sheets (MSDSs).

Process Hazard Analysis
Our facility conduct comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with our processes are identified and controlled efficiently. Tremco Corsicana primarily uses the checklist and HAZOP method analysis techniques to perform these evaluations. The studies were undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and will be revalidated at regular intervals.  Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.

Executive Summary for Tremco Corsicana Plant

1.  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
The Tremco Corsicana Plant (Corsicana), has always had a strong commitment to its employees to provide a safe working environment. This policy is consistent with both the spirit and the intent of our commitment.  The safety of employees, company operations, and the public are management's most important complete compliance with all safety regulations and safety policies.

Every attempt will be made to reduce the possibility of accident occurrence by all levels of management. Tremco Corsicana believes that safety, like quality and housekeeping, can be controlled by motivated supervision.  Therefore, preventable lost time accidents will have an impact on a supervisor's annual salary review, including any bonuses and incentive plans.  Unreported accidents will be considered falsification of company records and will result in immediate discharge.  Lost time accident free locations will be eligible for annual awards.

2.  The Station Source and the Regulated Substances Handled
Tremco Corsicana operates a specialty chemical plant and manufactures fatty amines and nitrile intermediates.  The principal products are emulsifiers, corrosion inhibitors, de-emulsifiers, and surfactants.

We have nine regulated substances present at our facility as raw materials for processes, which include dimethylamine (DMA), acrylonitrile, anhydrous ammonia, hydrogen, formaldehyde, methyl chloride (MeCl), epichlorohydrin, trimethylamine (TMA), and hydrochloric acid (HCl).  Acrylonitrile, anhydrous ammonia, formaldehyde, epichlorohydrin, methyl chloride, and hydrochloric acid are regulated as toxic chemicals and trimethylamine, hydrogen, and dimethylamine are regulated as flammable chemicals. The quantity of hydrogen at this facility is below the threshold level of 10,000 pounds.
